alert.note: Alert for Cass; Fulton; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke; White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 05 at 1:42PM EDT until August 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: .A slow moving and moisture rich system has a history of producing rain rates of 1 inch per hour at times. Training of heavy rain rates has been noted as well. Rain totals approaching 2 to as much as 4 inches is possible in the watch area. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following areas, Cass IN, Fulton IN, Marshall, Pulaski, Starke and White. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain totals approaching 2 to as much as 4 inches is possible in the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Fulton; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke; White
